docs.lead_paragraph: Authorities ordered an investigation Friday after at least 24 poor and elderly people went blind following cataract surgeries performed at a free medical camp run by a charity in northern India.

headline.main: 24 Go Blind After Cataract Surgery in India
headline.print_headline: 24 Go Blind After Cataract Surgery in India

docs.lead_paragraph: No, Obamacare wasn’t a mistake. Democrats should be celebrating that they did the right thing.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column questions why Democrats like Sen Charles Schumer are declaring that health care reform, Obama administration's signature achievement, was a mistake; notes that health care reform continues to rack up remarkable successes; describes how Schumer's critique is wrong, and that if more Democrats had been willing to defend it the politics of the issue might look very different.
docs.snippet: No, Obamacare wasn’t a mistake. Democrats should be celebrating that they did the right thing.

docs.lead_paragraph: Multiemployer pension plans, often involving unionized workers, were once common in industries like coal mining, trucking and construction. But they’re running out of money.

headline.main: A Strategy for Pensions at Risk of Extinction
headline.print_headline: A Strategy for Pensions at Risk of Extinction

docs.abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column notes that annual report released by Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation shows that multiemployer pension plans will most likely run out of money within a few years; warns that absent new legislation, pensions of some retired workers will be eliminated; laments that political system seems unwilling to even consider taxpayer-supported solution.
docs.snippet: Multiemployer pension plans, often involving unionized workers, were once common in industries like coal mining, trucking and construction. But they’re running out of money.

docs.lead_paragraph: As same-sex marriage gains ground, advocates are planning to seek broader protections akin to those provided for women and racial minorities in 1964.

headline.main: Rights Bill Sought for Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual and Transgender Americans
headline.print_headline: Rights Bill Sought for Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual and Transgender Americans

docs.abstract: Gay rights advocates are seeking legislation for broader protection of lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people from discrimination; plans for civil rights bill are still in early stages, but advocates envision it to be comparable to 1964 Civil Rights Act.
docs.snippet: As same-sex marriage gains ground, advocates are planning to seek broader protections akin to those provided for women and racial minorities in 1964.

docs.lead_paragraph: A ProPublica analysis found that many health insurance plans offered in the federal marketplace are changing their benefits heading into 2015.

headline.main: Big Changes in Fine Print of Some 2015 Health Plans
headline.print_headline: Hidden in the Fine Print, Big Changes in Some ’15 Health Plans

docs.abstract: ProPublica analysis of 2014 and 2015 health care plans being offered on federal government's health insurance exchange in 34 states shows that many plans have made changes that could markedly affect how much consumers pay; people seeking health care on exchange face complex battery of choices as they pick plans for 2015.
docs.snippet: A ProPublica analysis found that many health insurance plans offered in the federal marketplace are changing their benefits heading into 2015.

docs.lead_paragraph: Officials said that millions of people with health insurance purchased in the federal marketplace would need to switch plans to avoid increases in premiums or reductions in subsidies.

headline.main: Officials Say Price Comparison Is Crucial to Choosing Health Plans
headline.print_headline: Officials Say Price Comparison Is Crucial to Choosing Health Plans

docs.abstract: Obama administration officials say millions of people with health insurance they bought through federal marketplace will need to change to different health plans for 2015 to dodge anticipated increases in premiums or reductions in subsidies under Affordable Care Act.
docs.snippet: Officials said that millions of people with health insurance purchased in the federal marketplace would need to switch plans to avoid increases in premiums or reductions in subsidies.

docs.lead_paragraph: Many people covered under President Barack Obama's health care law will face higher premiums next year, the administration acknowledged Thursday. While the average increases are modest, it's more fodder for the nation's political battles over health care.
